channel.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
channel.description:
Before saying 'search google' or 'l2google' I have been doing this all day and had no luck [b]yet[/b] so I am turning to this community to give me a few suggestions that may have worked for them.
My xbox has been sitting for a few months while I was waiting for a new game to come out (BF3). I bought it yesterday, when I got home I plugged in my xbox to find out the power cord had went bad. I went to gamestop and got a replacement. I got home too late to really do anything so I waiting until this morning. I plugged it in, sure enough the Xbox turns on without a problem. I connect it to the internet, let it update etc. When it's all done I put in the BF3 single campaign disc and all I get is 'Open Tray', even with some games I had been playing before I let it sit.
I have taken the Xbox apart (there is no warranty anymore, so stuff it) and I think the optical laser is bad. When I first turn on the xbox it does nothing at all, but when I open and close the CD drive it will blink once, before the disc even starts to spin. Could this be a firmware issue or shall I keep searching the internet for a solution.
DVD Drive in Xbox: Philips Lite-On

item.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

SilentCJ:

Mine’s got the same issue, just needs a replacement DVD drive, can buy them from amazon for around $20 or so, make sure you get the same make of drive mind.

Alright, I guess that’s my last option. Thanks. Only bad part, I hear that I will need to swap the new drives board with the new one. Is that true?

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Mine’s got the same issue, just needs a replacement DVD drive, can buy them from amazon for around $20 or so, make sure you get the same make of drive mind.

item.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“devenb123, post:5, topic:423082”]GO TO GAMESTOP/BESBUY or wherever you got it. They WILL help you for free if not cheap.
GL bro.[/quote]
Lol no, they wont. At least not any usable help.
1> I called gamestop to see if they carried any drives that I could just swap the boards and plug in. No
2> Bestbuy is not a console service center, my uncle called them this morning and got exactly what I was telling him. They don’t service the Xbox360

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Is this the new slim? My friend had this problem and he sent it in to get it fixed (I know you can’t now), but I’m pretty sure it is because of the laser. Not much help, but just threw in 2 cents.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox360 dvd drive problem
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

pk2play:

Does the xbox read the game as a dvd?

It doesn’t read it at all. I am wondering if flashing a custom firmware onto the cd drive will fix it.

Read full topic
